1.title: Powers & Principalities
1.author: writer, J
1.appears_in: Michael Straczynski ; artist, Gary Frank ; inker, Jon Sibal ; colors, Chris Sotomayor ; letters, Rus Wooton.
notes: "Contains material originally published in magazine form as Supreme Power #7-12."

"When godlike Hyperion discovers his whole life has actually been an elaborate government-made lie, his reaction could mean the end of the Earth. Do the world's other super-powered beings have any chance at stopping Hyperion if the truth sends him over the edge?"

3.heading: Powers of the Body.
3.title: The Illustrious Omnibus of Super Powers.
3.author: [No author]
notes: A chart classifying superheroes and their powers. The main catagegories are Powers of the body, Animal powers, Force control, Mastery, Weapons-based, Powers of the mind, and Object manipulation.
"This product is intended as a fun gift item and not as a definitive reference guide or educational tool."

21.heading: Powhatan, Chief.
21.title: Disney's Pocahontas
21.author: adapted from the film by Gina Ingoglia ; illustrated by Franc Mateu.
notes: Summary (from SkyRiver): Even the wild mountain stream must someday join the big river. That's what Pocahontas's father, Chief Powhatan, tells her. He wants her to settle down, marry one of his warriors, and take her proper place in the tribe. But free-spirited Pocahontas has other ideas, especially after she meets the handsome Englishman John Smith. Will her love for this blue-eyed stranger bring her the freedom and true happiness she seeks, or will it bring misfortune and war to the whole tribe?

31.heading: Powle, Madhu.
31.title: "Harsha : a Gallant King of Kanauj"
31.author: script, Yagya Sharma, Anand Prakash Singh ; illustrations, Madhu Powle ; editor, Anant Pai
31.appears_in: 32 p. in Amar Chitra Katha, no. 627 (1972, 2010 printing).
notes: "Starting off as the ruler of tiny Thaneshwar, Harsha (7th century AD) rose to become the powerful monarch of the kingdom of Kanauj. He avenged the wicked assassination of his elder brother and the cowardly abduction of his sister. His biographer Bona Bhatta and the Chinese traveler Hiuen Tsang were unanimous in their praise of this learned king, whose fame did much to create a glowing image of India in lands far away."

43.heading: The Pox.
43.title: Little Willie.
43.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: Little Willie wins a cotton-picking contest, and with his winnings buys a new suit, gets a date, contracts the pox, and finds that the Rapid Treatment Center can cure him within two weeks.
Educational comic book on syphilis and sexually transmitted diseases, about and for African Americans.
